sentence.Network_en: No sooner had he arrived in Rome than he was kidnapped.
sentence.Network_cn: 他刚到罗马就遭到了绑架。

sentence.Network_en: In 1973, when he lived in Rome, his sixteen-year-old son was kidnapped.
sentence.Network_cn: 1973年他在罗马居住时，他16岁的儿子遭到了绑架。

sentence.Network_en: Two businessmen have been kidnapped by terrorists.
sentence.Network_cn: 两名商人遭恐怖分子绑架。

yes , she pretended she had been kidnapped .对，她假装被人绑架了。

by air and come my city see me. if you don't answer , i will by bike and to your city , and to kidnap you .如果你同意，你就坐飞机来我这，如果你不同意，我就骑车去你那并绑架你。
the sinister and vicious robbers kidnapped the professor ., 歹毒的强盗绑架了教授.
everybody tries to kidnap your attention ., 每个人试着吸引你的注意.

entry.def: To kidnap someone is to take them away illegally and by force, and usually to hold them prisoner in order to demand something from their family, employer, or government.

example.ex: Police in Brazil uncovered a plot to kidnap him...
example.tran: 巴西警方发现了有人要绑架他的阴谋。

example.ex: They were intelligent and educated, yet they chose to kidnap and kill...
example.tran: 他们聪明且有教养，却选择去绑架和杀人。

entry.def: Kidnap or a kidnap is the crime of taking someone away by force.

example.ex: Stewart denies attempted murder and kidnap...
example.tran: 斯图尔特否认对其谋杀未遂和绑架的指控。

example.ex: He was charged with the kidnap of a 25 year-old woman.
example.tran: 他被指控绑架一名25岁的女子。

means.word_mean: 1. (of persons) seized and detained unlawfully, often for ransom;

sentences.sentence: "the father restored the kidnapped (or abducted) child to the mother"
